question: Sophia has a flower bed that is 174 feet long. Sophia wants to fill her flower bed with plants. Sophia's flowers grow 6 inches wide so she needs to leave 7.0 feet between every plant. Sophia already owns 18 flowers. Each flowering plant costs £13 at the store, how much money will Sophia spend at the store to fill up her flower bed?
answer:
Sophia's flower bed is 174 feet / 7 feet per plant = <<174/7=24>>24 plants needed.
Sophia needs to buy 24 plants - 18 plants = <<24-18=6>>6 plants needed to purchase.
Sophia will spend 6 plants * £13 = £<<6*13=89>>89.
#### 89
